title: CTRL0000055538 - Transcribed Interview of Kelli Ward, (March 16, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 2:30 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a deposition of Dr. Kelli Ward conducted by the House Select Committee to
Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House
Dr. Ward, could you please state your full name and spell your last name for the
This will be a staff-led deposition today, and members of the select committee
may, of course, choose to join us and will also ask questions.
Since we're doing this remotely, there's a participant list on the side of our Webex
you'll be able to see their names appear there.
the convention usually is that they'll turn on their video, so they'll pop up on your screen
We will try to identify any members of the select committee if they join and
senior investigative counsel to the committee.
I'm investigative counsel with the select committee.
And I'll let my colleagues here in the room today with me also introduce themselves.
And then, if they have any questions,
professional staff member with the committee.
We're joined by a couple of other members of the select committee staff,
also investigative counsel with the committee, a n d -
Before we begin, we'd like to go through a few ground rules.
We will be following the House deposition rules today that we provided to your
Under the House deposition rules, counsel for other persons or
government agencies may not attend, and you are, Dr. Ward, permitted to have your
Under the House rules neither committee members nor staff may discuss the
substance of your testimony that you provide today unless the committee approves
And you and your attorney can have an opportunity to review the transcript if
At this time, counsel, could you please note your appearances for the record?
There is an official reporter transcribing the record of this deposition.
ask you, Dr. Ward, to please wait until each question is completed before you begin your
response, and we will try to wait until your responses are all complete before we ask our
The stenographer cannot record nonverbal responses, such as shaking your head,
so it's important that you please answer each question with an audible verbal response.
We are, as you noted at the beginning, we are recording this deposition that's
being conducted virtually, but the official record of the deposition is the record that the
We ask that you provide complete answers based on your best recollection.
the questions are not clear, please ask for clarification and we'd be happy to provide it.
And then if you do not know the answer, please simply say so.
You may only refuse to answer a question to preserve a privilege that is
privilege, staff may either proceed with the deposition or seek a ruling from the chair on
If you refuse to answer a question based on a
If the chair overrules an objection, you are required to answer the
Again, please don't hesitate to ask us to repeat a question if you have any trouble
hearing us or if it's not clear, and if you need to consult with your counsel at any time
during this interview -- or during this deposition, sorry -- that's not a problem at all.
Because we're doing this virtually, we recommend that you mute and turn off
your cameras to facilitate any sort of -- any private conversation that you need to have
If you need to have a break for any other reason during the deposition, please just
let us know and we'd be happy to accommodate that.
And finally, I want to remind you that it is unlawful to deliberately provide false
And since this deposition will be under oath, providing false
information could result in criminal penalties for perjury and/or for providing false

So at this time, could you please stand and raise your right
hand to be sworn by the official reporter?
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
I do, so help me God.
At this point, I'd like to make my statement before you continue.
